presets.description: General purpose OpenStreetMap preset for Vespucci and JOSM, based on the original JOSM version
presets.shortdescription: Default OpenStreetMap Preset for Vespucci and JOSM

list_entry.short_description: Robust Wheels: trekking bike, car, rickshaw
High Clearance: light duty off-road vehicle
0: Solid gravel/packed earth, no obstacles, wide curves
1: Some loose surface, small obstacles, wide curves
2: Much loose surface, large obstacles, easy hairpins
3: Slippery surface, large obstacles, tight hairpins
4: Loose surface or boulders, dangerous hairpins
0: Graveled or hardened earth. Good Grip. Avg. incline 10%
1: Graveled or hardened earth. Good Grip. Avg. incline 15%
2: Mostly stable, unsurfaced, partly washed out
3: Variable Surface, tight corners, small steps, surface rocks, earth or grass.
4: Way is very steep, or in bad condition for pedalling uphill. Steps, trees, roots, tight corners.
5: Way is too steep and/or too difficult to ride uphill.

combo.long_text: Number of lanes in way direction
Number of lanes opposite way direction

text.long_text: Maximum speed in km/h if no units specified

combo.long_text: For indoor mapping, level 0 is the ground floor

text.text: Number of rooms suitable for wheelchairs

list_entry.short_description: Full post office operated by 3rd party
Plants that are leafless for a certain period during the year.
Plants that are never entirely without green foliage.
Plants that lose their foliage for a very short period, when old leaves fall off and new foliage growth is starting.
Plants that lose most, but not all, of their foliage for a fraction of the year.
Plants that are leafless for a certain period during the year.
Plants that are never entirely without green foliage.
Plants that lose their foliage for a very short period, when old leaves fall off and new foliage growth is starting.
Plants that lose most, but not all, of their foliage for a fraction of the year.
Habitat with evergreen and deciduous vegetation.
Trees remarkable due to its size or prominent location, usually visible from great distances and useful for navigation.
Especially old tree, often with a particular shape. Usually protected for its uniqueness.
Trees found within settlements, e.g. in parks or spread through residential areas.

list_entry.short_description: A sauna is available but its type is not specified.
A Finnish-style sauna with a temperature of over 60°C because of the water thrown on the rocks of the stove. This kind of sauna is relatively dry because of the high temperature.
A Turkish-style steam sauna with a lower temperature and limited visibility because of the steam generated.
A sauna-like construction that is used for infrared therapy.
A non-steam dry sauna in which water is not thrown on the stove.
A Finnish-style hot sauna in which the stove has no chimney but instead the smoke fills the room when the sauna is prepared, and the smoke is then ventilated out when the sauna is ready.
A Korean-style hot and dry sauna, in which water is not thrown on the stove.
A sauna that constantly has an aroma, NOT a Finnish sauna with occasional aroma liquid added to the water.
